title: Cold wave in 13 districts, chill to ease slightly in next few days | The Financial Express
text:
The Financial Express National 2 hours ago Cold wave in 13 districts, chill to ease slightly in next few days
Published :
Jan 03, 2025 09:01 Updated :
Jan 03, 2025 09:02 Share this news
For all latest news, follow The Financial Express Google News channel. Thirteen districts in the country are currently experiencing a cold wave, but the Bangladesh Meteorological Department says that the chill will ease a bit over the next few days as the temperature rises.
Meteorologist Shahnaz Sultana said, “It is not possible to say whether the cold wave will ease, but the temperature will increase slightly. As a result, the cold will decrease for a few days,” as per a bdnews24.com report.
The Met office’s regular bulletin on Friday said that a mild cold wave is blowing over the Rajshahi, Pabna, Bogura, Naogaon, and Kushtia districts and the Rangpur Division.
The BMD forecast says that the temperature will increase over the 24 hours from 9:00 am on Friday.
The lowest temperature in the country on that day was recorded at 8.3 Degrees Celsius, recorded in Panchagarh’s Tentulia.
The Met Office’s long-term forecast for January says that the country may see one to three mild to moderate cold waves and one to two severe cold waves in the month.
Night temperatures across the country may increase slightly and the day temperatures in the western part of the country may increase by 1.0 to 3.0 Degrees Celsius. Apart from this, the temperatures in other parts of the country are likely to remain unchanged.
Due to dense fog, it may feel chillier in some places across the country during the day.
The weather forecast says that moderate to dense fog may fall across the country from midnight to the morning and may persist in some places until noon.
Due to dense fog, air traffic, inland river transport and road communication may be temporarily disrupted.
